data.message: Holidays? Holidays are coming? Sorry, are we not using the C Word?

replies.message: Hi Tom, we use the term 'holidays' as not everyone celebrates Christmas, but we want to help everybody get into the festive feeling whatever the occasion.
Its always been holidays are coming
it's always been holidays. don't make this something it isn't
Why is it a picture of Father Christmas then?
Obviously it’s still about Christmas and the festive season. It’s been “Holidays Are Coming” ever since I’ve seen the adverts.
Also, the way Father Christmas is portrayed in modern times is somewhat down to Coca-Cola so they’re still going to use that image.
It's also the American term for Christmas and Coca Cola is American
Tom Barter  ps your asking why they didn't use the word Christmas yet you didn't even use if you were making a point about the word you should of used it.... in capitals!
It’s never been Christmas is coming it’s #holidaysarecoming as a big fan of the lorry and advert I know this info
It's always been holidays! It only says it a million times in the song that plays on the Coca Cola ad every year!
Because the C word is not suitable for a family advert 😉 It's always been holidays are coming. Stop trying to make it into something it isn't 🤔
The only ongoing problem is that haircut of yours Tom Barter 😂😂😂
Interestingly I've just had it changed.
How could anyone possibly be angered by coca cola's response, it's perfectly reasonable. So easy to offend people these days
Nah Coca-Cola it's a CHRISTMAS advert, therefore it should be #christmasiscoming

It's always been 'Holidays are coming!' and I'm pretty sure Coca-Cola were in part responsible for how santa looks nowadays wearing a white fur trimmed outfit and not a traditional robe... It's all advertising.
It's always been holidays are coming!
